description: The app is good and fast, but lacks support for one importatnt file type and that is EPUB. I know that PDF is the dominant format for portable documants, but EPUB is way more versatile than PDF because it's essentially raw HTML. EPUB flexible in terms of formatting and can be read in almost any screen ratio. Since GNOME Desktop is pushing the LibAdwaita design to make applications suitable for Desktop and Tablet screens, EPUB support for its future document reader is essential to make reading in GNOME a better experience.

"Document Viewer" that ships default with Fedora remembers your last opened documents. Additionally, you can launch the program from CLI ("evince"), which makes usage with Fuzzyfind great. Papers is still missing these as far as I can tell.
